intro: Thibaudia pachyantha, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soil. Its flowers are usually violet or blue in color, with five petals and prominent stamens. Thibaudia pachyantha is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
